hive_lesson.title: 1054 Pest Protection
hive_lesson.description: Shirley talks about being a custom official.

hive_text_custom.text: I remember watching a television documentary in the United States a few years ago that
they brought up the subject of these toads that live in Australia that supposedly have some substance that is for humans a hallucinogenic, does that

Well, I don’t know about those ones specifically but I know that in Australia for example we have a huge Cane Toad problem. Cane toads are very big toads they are about the size of a small cantelope probably, and someone brought them in at the

and they got loose in northern Australia and now there’s thousands and thousands and thousands of hectares covered with Cane toads and every year it costs the government a huge amount of money trying to control them and they’ve become a pest. And that’s one of the reasons why we have such strict quarantine regulations.
. Of course, I guess we all know about the rabbits.
Yes, rabbits were first brought into Australia from Britain, and probably just as someone’s pet and one got out …
You weren’t on duty that day
I wasn’t on duty that day probably because it was maybe about a hundred years ago

That’s true. Anyway, the rabbits got loose and there was periods in Australian history where there were millions and millions of rabbits and huge control programs and one of the things that they did to control them, which I think eventually did control them was they gave them a disease called “myxomatosis” which doesn’t kill the rabbit but makes them go blind … so they get infected with it. I think that it’s
a small flea and they go blind and I think, rather horribly, they either starve to death or they, you know, they just can’t survive. And that was what controlled them
Uh huh, until they come up with an immunity to it.
Yeah, they don’t seem to have done that. I mean they’re still around a little bit, but not in the numbers, not in the plague numbers that they used to be in the past.
So now it’s toads that are the big problem.
Yeah well, there’s other things as well but … yeah, toads are an ongoing problem.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1) A television documentary in the United States had a story about ______.
2) Cane toads were brought to Australia in about _______.

answers: b) they are too great in numbers.
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 3) The rabbits are pests because ______.

answers: a) killing the rabbits with guns
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 4) The plague rabbit population in Australia was controlled by _______.

answers: b) not nice for the rabbits
hive_lesson_quiz.question: 5) Shirley thinks that the method of controlling the rabbit problem was ____.

hive_text_custom.text: we almost left, but we decided to stay.
They did not buy the house
to spend more than you earn.
